title: Fontanafredda 2012 Serralunga d'Alba  (Barolo)
description: Fragrant and structured, this offers enticing scents of rose, violet, menthol, underbrush and a whiff of leather. The juicy palate offers layers of crushed raspberry, fleshy black cherry, cinnamon, clove, tobacco and a hint of anise alongside velvety tannins. It's already accessible. Drink through 2022.

title: Gróf Degenfeld 2014 Zomborka Furmint (Tokaj)
description: This Furmint from Tokaj has enticing aromas of lemon, grapefruit peel and vanilla bean. There are lively flavors of lemon curd, dried sage and caramelized apricot in the palate with balanced minerality in the finish.

title: Doña Paula 2010 El Alto Parcel Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Earthy berry aromas come with a note of balsam wood, tobacco and soy sauce. This is juicy, with sinewy tannins and a sense of perpetual hardness to the palate. Lightly herbal blackberry and plum flavors exhibit a stalky note. Toasty and tannic on the finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Doña Paula 2011 Alluvia Parcel Malbec (Tupungato)
description: Warm, earthy, slightly horsey berry aromas are brambly and spicy. This Malbec feels flush but reduced and hard at the edges. Potent but crude boysenberry and plum flavors show a raisiny note, while this is long at the end, with earth notes and lemon peel. Drink through 2018.

title: Doña Paula 2011 Selección de Bodega Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Fiery cherry, blackberry, spice, toast and animal aromas lead to a racy, intense, narrow palate. Plum, blackberry and peppery flavors finish with toastiness, spice and juicy acidity that highlights the high tones in this blend of three Malbec vineyards. Drink through 2022.

title: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2015 Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Dry Riesling (Mosel)
description: Stone, smoke and mineral oil aromas juxtapose deeply concentrated flavors of peach, tangerine and quince on the palate of this deftly balanced Riesling. While dry in style, it's lusciously mouth-filling, suggesting swirls of honey and citrus. A long, steel-touched finish dries everything up nicely. It's lovely now but should continue to improve through 2022 and likely beyond.
designation: Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Dry

title: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2015 Wehlener Sonnenuhr Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: The nose of this pretty kabinett starts off demure, wafting fresh grapefruit, sage and lavender scents. The palate, by contrast, boasts tropical mango and berry tones. Boldly concentrated and brisk in acidity, it's a punchy, four-square Riesling with appeal well into the 2020s.

title: Paitin 2013 Sorì Paitin  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with classic Nebbiolo aromas of ripe red berry, violet, leather, dark spice and a balsamic note. The chewy palate doles out fleshy Marasca cherry, licorice clove and a hint of pipe tobacco alongside robust but smooth tannins. Drink from 2018 through 2023.

title: Paolo Scavino 2012 Bricco Ambrogio  (Barolo)
description: Perfumed berry, fragrant blue flower and a hint of toasted hazelnut lead the way. On the taut palate, notes of star anise, white pepper and coffee bean accent a core of juicy red berry. Firm but refined tannins provide the elegant framework.

title: Rivetto 2012 del Comune di Serralunga  (Barolo)
description: Truffle, fig, underbrush, toast and chopped mint aromas emerge in the glass along with a whiff of cocoa. The firm palate shows dried black cherry, cinnamon, clove and star anise alongside assertive tannins that need to unwind. Drink 2018–2024.

title: RouteStock 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: A consistently great white, this vintage is as impressive as ever, exhibiting steely, rocky minerality around savory, smooth layers marked by light, pretty flavors of key lime and lemon peel.

title: Ruca Malen 2011 Kinien de Don Raúl Red (Mendoza)
description: Intense, fiery aromas of licorice, blackberry and marzipan are rooty and still a bit raw after years in bottle. This Malbec blend is lush and ripe, but blocky tannins show some bite. Flavors of black fruits and toasty oak finish even more blackened and toasty. Drink through 2021.

title: Entropy Cellars 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: Well rounded, subtly spicy and deep in fruit concentration, this full-bodied wine packs a lot of flavor into an almost deceptively smooth package. It has plenty of black cherry, blackberry and cocoa notes to savor and a texture that's saturated with fine-grained tannins. Best after 2018.

title: Epiphany 2013 Hampton Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: This bottling shows off more savory smoke than fresh fruit, with soy, black and white pepper and teriyaki/peppercorn-crusted beef aromas. The structure is surprisingly fresher and more clean, with lighter blueberry, pepper and more soy.

title: Mommessin 2014 Deux Terroirs Grande Exception  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: This spicy wine is ripe, fresh and richly fruity. Plenty of toast contrasts with the yellow fruit and grapefruit. This full-bodied wine is ripe, generous and ready to drink.

title: Musso 2013 Rio Sordo  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of fragrant purple flower, ripe berry and pipe tobacco lift out of the glass. On the generous palate, notes of vanilla, cinnamon and nutmeg accent mature cherry and crushed raspberry. Smooth, velvety tannins leave a polished mouthfeel. Drink through 2023.

title: Quinta da Lapa 2013 Homenagem Reserva Red (Tejo)
description: The quinta that produced this wine already has one of Saint Teresa d'Avila's poems etched above its doorway and now it's honoring the 500th anniversary of her birth with this release. This is a solid blend of rich dark fruits that offers earthly comfort. It is spicy, dark and densely structured. Fine acidity keeps the wine fresh at the end. Drink from 2017.

title: Quinta de Lemos 2008 Dona Georgina Red (Dão)
description: This eight-year old wine, based on Touriga Nacional, is ripe, now mature with the tannins fully integrated into the rich black fruit. It is firm with a structure that gives concentration and perfumed acidity. The wine is still dark and dense although ready to drink.

title: Mirafiore 2012 Paiagallo  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of ripe berry, dark baking spice, leather, menthol and purple flower permeate the nose on this focused wine. The firmly structured palate offers licorice, dried black cherry and clove alongside assertive tannins. Drink 2018–2025.

title: Hahn 2014 SLH Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This is a lot of heady wine for a relatively affordable price. Aromas of black-cherry syrup, baked black plum, nutmeg, clove and gingerbread make for an attention-grabbing nose. The hearty palate shows similar elements, along with black peppercorn, Christmas spice, dense blackberry paste, chaparral scrub and pine-forest notes.

title: Henri de Villamont 2014 Les Renardes  (Corton)
description: This big, ripe wine features red fruits, acidity and a touch of young tannins. It is structured, with chocolate and some licorice flavors that are balanced with the strawberry and ripe tannins. Drink from 2020.

title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014 Creux de la Net Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)
description: Tight, mineral and balanced, this a perfumed, fragrant and crisply fruity wine. With its bright acidity, touch of toast and nervy aftertaste, the wine is not quite ready. It comes from an east-facing vineyard across a small valley from the Corton-Charlemagne Grand Cru. Drink from 2017.
designation: Creux de la Net Premier Cru

title: Sonoma-Loeb 2014 Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Grown in Green Valley, this medium-bodied wine offers heady Asian spices seasoned over tart, tangy orange and cherry. Pretty aromatics ride shotgun over a depth of earth and soft tannin and smoky oak, the wine ultimately plush and lush.

title: Domaine Fourrey 2014 Mont de Milieu Premier Cru  (Chablis)
description: This is a ripe, rounded and aromatic wine, with just the right stretch of minerality and juicy citrus flavor. Crisp, tangy and refreshing in its fruitiness, the wine is rich and full, finishing with a final burst acidity.

title: Louis Latour 2014 En Caradeux Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)
description: With a touch of spice from the wood, this wine is full of yellow and apple fruits yet with a cool thread of acidity. It is a lively, bright wine, filled out with fruitiness. Drink from 2017.

title: Louis Max 2014 Aux Fourneaux Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
description: Opulent and ripe, this wine has fine tannins that support the rich red fruit and smoky acidity. The weight and concentration of the wine make it so attractive and indicate it will develop well. Drink from 2019.

title: Maçanita Vinhos 2013 Tinto Red (Douro)
description: With 50% new oak aging, this is a rich and spicy wine that also has layers of dense toastiness. Black currants and blackberries come together with the structure and fine acidity to give a rich, concentrated wine that should still age further. Drink from 2018.

title: Icardi 2012 Parej  (Barolo)
description: Subtle oak, toast, coffee bean and grilled herb are some of the aromas you'll find on this. The ripe, juicy palate offers raspberry compote, white pepper, clove and a hint of orange peel while fine-grained tannins lend polished support.

title: Sarah's Vineyard 2012 Madonne Estate Red (Santa Clara Valley)
description: There is a lot of herbal and woody nuance to the nose of this blend of 72% Grenache, 10% Syrah, 10% Mourvèdre, 5% Carignane and 3% Counoise. Thyme, dried fennel and Earl Grey tea aromas lift the dark strawberry fruit. Shaved cedar flavors frame the palate, where lavender and other purple flowers integrate seamlessly into the soft red fruit.

title: Verget 2014 Vignes de Saint-Claude  (Saint-Véran)
description: This wine is full, rich and packed with yellow fruits. Spice and toastiness add to the complexity and attraction. It is a delicious, ripe wine with zesty acidity and a tight final texture.
